Jind and Dadri farmers seek mercy killin.description: JIND: The farmers in Jind and Charkhi Dadri districts have written a letter to the President seeking mercy killing. The farmers have been staging a protest for past two months as they seek higher compensation for their land acquired for constructing the National Highway 152-D, between Narnaul and Ambala that touches eight district and around 200 villages in Haryana. The farmers from eight villages of Jind’s Julana town and 17 villages of Charkhi Dadri district had been protesting for more compensation for around 1,000 acre land acquired in 2018. They want Rs 2 crore per acre as compensation. They alleged the compensation announced by the government in these 25 villages was far less. Talking to TOI, farmers’ leader Ramesh Dalal said they had a meeting with Union minister for road transport & highways Nitin Gadkari in presence of Haryana chief minister M L Khattar and minister of state for road transport and highways V K Singh in New Delhi on June 12 but action was still awaited. “In that meeting, Gadkari and CM had assured to resolve the issue within couple of days but now a week has passed and nothing happened,” he added. Dalal said, “Distressed farmers are not left with any option but to seek euthanasia from President Ram Nath Kovind. Issues of farmers have always been ignored by all governments.” “One Dadri farmer Jagdish had committed suicide while fighting with the system. Now, farmers are tired seeking justice,” he said, adding that farmers had sought attention of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the matter now. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gang kidnaps and thrashes duo, six booke.description: GURUGRAM: Six people have been booked for allegedly kidnapping and thrashing two Pataudi residents in Khod village on Wednesday. Though the complainant haven’t hinted at any personal enmity, police suspect some dispute over money to be the reason behind the crime. Hariom (23), a resident of ward 7 of Pataudi, told police that the crime took place around 9.30am on Wednesday when he and his friend Vinod were chatting at Nohta Chowk. “Vikas, a resident of Jhajjar, reached the Chowk with five others in an SUV. He asked us to get into the car. As we refused, they dragged us inside and started thrashing us. They drove till Khod village, where they tied us up near a tubewell. They thrashed us again after tying our hands and legs. They left us there and left the spot after threatening to kill us,” Hariom said. A villager came to their rescue, following which they informed the police. After the medical examination of the duo, an FIR was registered against the accused under sections 147 (rioting), 149 (unlawful assembly), 323 (causing hurt), 365 (kidnap), 506 (criminal intimidation) of the IPC at Pataudi police station. “The victims have identified the accused as Vikas, Rohit, Monu, Jaibir, Hemant and Bholi. Prima facie, it seems to be a dispute over money, but we are verifying the facts. Arrests will be made soon,” said ASI Krishan Kumar, the investigating officer. Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Central panel nixes AIIMS plan in Rewari.description: GURUGRAM: A committee appointed by the Union ministry of environment, forest and climate change (MoEF&CC) has turned down a proposal to build an AIIMS in Manethi village of Rewari. The project was planned over 235 acres falling under Aravali plantation. The committee rejected the proposal saying the area has dense forest with 16,000 trees and 21,000 plants, and is home to many wild species including black buck (Haryana’s state animal) and sambhar. Sources in the ministry said the project was turned down because of two factors. “First, Haryana already has very low forest cover — at 3.59% of its geographical area. Second, Manethi has dense forest with over 16,000 fully-grown trees and is home to many wild species,” said an official, requesting anonymity. Even though the district administration proposed to divert land to the forest department in Masani barrage, so that non-forest activity could be carried out in Manethi, the committee turned down the proposal and suggested the state government should look for alternatives. “Destroying existing, dense forest at Manethi and carrying out fresh plantation at Masani barrage will not only be destructive for the environment, but also will not be cost effective. We’ve suggested the government should look for an alternative site. In fact, Masani barrage could be a good option to build the healthcare facility,” said the official. Calling it a violation of the Supreme Court judgement, former forest conservator R P Balwan told TOI, “The proposal was bound to be rejected. In the case of T N Godavarman Thirumulpad vs Union of India, the Supreme Court clearly said ‘forest’ must be understood according to its ‘dictionary meaning’. In many other orders, the same was reiterated by the Apex court. The Aravali plantation, therefore, is clearly deemed forest. Authorities should have applied their mind before proposing a project on forest land. There is a large chunk of land owned by panchayats in the state. Establishing AIIMS is certainly important, but it can easily be planned on panchayat or private land.” Talking about the importance of the Manethi forest, renowned forester and former principal chief conservator of forests (Rajasthan) R N Mehrotra, said, “Manethi has dense forest which is home to many wild species. Most importantly, the globally threatened White-naped Tit (parus nuchalis) is found here. Also, the Aravali foothills have huge ecological importance as it recharges groundwater. There is a need to protect such forests as we are already facing climate emergency.” During 1990s and 2000s, European Union funds were spent to carry out plantation in the Aravalis. Nearly 3.3 crore trees were planted at a cost of Rs 175 crore, over 30,000 hectares across 13 districts that comprise of Aravalis in Haryana. That included district Rewari, where plantation was carried out on 412 hectare in Manethi. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

A lot more needs to be done in field of.description: “I have had a very chequered career, if you may say,” confesses Ajoy Khandheria, an engineer by qualification and ‘entrepreneur evangelist’ with 25 years of experience, mostly in the telecom space. He is also the founder of Gramin Healthcare, a startup that, since 2016, has endeavoured to make quality healthcare accessible to the rural population. “Rural India still requires a medical practitioner to be physically present there — digital might be a good backup but healthcare delivery requires brick-and-mortar,” maintains Khandheria.  Switching domains I still hold equity in a few telecom companies, in Singapore, Dubai, India, etc., but I decided to go with a startup in healthcare. The first part of that startup was to provide consulting to Tier-2 hospitals and re-engineer them so they could increase their effectiveness. The idea was a replica of what Genpact does — increase the value and then take a share of the increment. But we realised it was very difficult to collect from the promoter in private hospitals. Then we decided to diversify and build orthopaedic and cardiac practices in hospitals in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities that did not have this service, which was actually not very scalable. From there we morphed into (providing) a second opinion for surgery patients online. Again, that was not scalable because everyone wanted to speak to the same (famous) doctor who could take only that many calls.  Dilemma & solution Some three year ago, a former colleague had joined IFFCO and told me about some horrible debt-trap stories due to hospital bills that drive a number of farmers/labourers to suicide. So, we decided to open brick-and-mortar clinics. IFFCO at that time was setting up IFFCO Bazar’s showrooms in villages by providing guidance to farmers on fertilisers, seeds and crops. But farmers kept demanding from IFFCO that we want healthcare and education. So it was decided that we set up a clinic with IFFCO Bazar. We started off with a partnership but after a few months, they realised the outcomes were good so they agreed to make us shareholders.  Partners in rural health Now we are by far the largest primary-care provider in rural India but we are probably less than 0.1% of the market, so there is a lot more that needs to be done. I hope other people learn from what we are doing because four-five new players will allow us to address 25% of the population over five years. We are also implementing Ayushman Bharat in Maharashtra and Haryana. Currently, we are spread in seven states but working with the Haryana government has been our best experience — they are very aggressive people, interested in doing good work, and very supportive.  Work/life: Finding the balance I actually do not work like an entrepreneur; I give more importance to family than work. Each year for the last eight years, I have spent 60 days straight with my kids. I learn a lot from my kids and I hope they learn something from me. Besides, I follow every sport on Planet Earth. I play golf and another sport which is not considered a sport by some — poker. I co-own Bangalore Warriors, a poker team in a league in India. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Visiting Saral Kendra? Take the kids too.description: GURUGRAM: If you are visiting the Saral Kendra or any other department at Mini Secretariat in Gurugram and are worried about leaving your child at home, you can now rest easy. A daycare centre that can accommodate about 25 children has been set up for the employees and visitors by the district administration. The centre, which will be thrown open on Wednesday noon, will have a woman attendant to look after children up to seven years of age. There will be an area for feeding babies, a toy section and a corner for changing diapers. Books for children will also be available. “Considering the multiplicity of departments and the inflow of people, we hope to see between 10 and 25 children daily to avail the facility. We will improve the facility based on the feedback we receive. It was a cumulative demand raised by various workers’ union and this has been successfully done by Power Grid in our complex. Three such facilities have been set up,” said deputy commissioner Amit Khatri. He has directed the officials to put up signages in the corners for visitors and employees. “Kindergarten is a basic facility for workers who have kids. It is to facilitate employees who don’t have anybody at home to look after their children. This would help them focus more on their work since they won’t be worried. As soon as we receive the feedback, we will include more things,” added Khatri. There has been a long-pending demand for a daycare centre at the district and sessions court in Gurugram. The new court complex in Sohna, which was inaugurated in December last year, also has a daycare centre for the children of lawyers, judges and litigants. For these Gurugram residents, it\u2019s.description: GURUGRAM: Residents of Sector 23 have expressed concern that several stretches near the sector market are riddled with potholes. Those residing in Palam Vihar have the same grouse. The condition of the roads is likely to worsen in the monsoon as the potholes will cause waterlogging, they said. Despite repeated complaints to MCG, no action has been taken yet, they claimed. “The Sector 23 market road has been in a shambles for several months now, and its condition is deteriorating day by day. We have been complaining to the MCG, but they have not taken any action so far,” said Pankaj Sharma, a resident. “Apart from posing the risk of accidents, potholes also damage vehicles and lead to a rise in dust pollution. MCG should repair this road at the earliest, because later on, they will come up with the excuse that the inclement weather isn’t allowing them to conduct repair work,” he added. Residents blamed shoddy infrastructural work by government agencies. “The problem areas in our sector are in and around the market. This is mainly because different government agencies dug up the road at different places for laying pipes, cables and other work, and didn’t repair them afterwards. This has damaged pavements and roads at several places in the sector. People are facing difficulty in commuting, and come monsoon, the problem will be aggravated,” said Bhawani Shankar Tripathy, another resident. An MCG official said the work to fill the potholes in Sector 23 will start in two days. “We have received the complaint and are going to start recarpeting the market road in two days. Once the work starts, it will take us around four days to cover the stretch,” a senior MCG official told TOI. Meanwhile, residents of Palam Vihar too complained that roads in the area are riddled with potholes. “MCG officials had come to meet our RWA in the last week of April for a meeting. We had raised this issue and told them that the main roads of the area should be repaired before the monsoon begins, as the condition of roads will worsen after that. But no repairs have been done so far,” Sunil Yadav, a resident of Palam Vihar, said. He added, “If you look at the state of the roads of Sector 1 in Palam Vihar, they are well maintained. Even their internal roads have been repaired. But both main and internal roads of sectors 2 and 3 are in a bad shape. At least the main roads of both sectors should be repaired before the rains start.” MCG officials couldn’t be reached for a comment on the issue. Gurugram: MG Road stays bumpy, littered.description: GURUGRAM: Damaged dividers, footpaths either broken or encroached upon, carriageways riddled with patchwork and potholes and illegal parking on the roadside. This sums up a visitor’s experience of the city’s arterial link — MG Road. With numerous malls, residential apartments, public and private offices along it, the road is forever jam-packed with commuters, especially during peak hours. The volume of traffic can be gauged from the presence of two of the city’s main metro stations here — MG Road and Sikanderpur — used daily by lakhs of officegoers from the city and its NCR neighbours. The administration has made many commitments in the past towards maintaining and beautifying the stretch. Last year, many master roads in the city, including MG Road, were transferred to GMDA. In December 2018, the department had announced that it would conduct repair and maintenance work on 12 stretches by March. However, TOI’s visit revealed that six months later, MG Road is still in a bad shape. Apart from the poor condition of the surface, chronic traffic jams during peak office hours, often due to wrong-side driving that broken dividers and illegal parking seem to encourage, make commute a harrowing experience on this road. Commenting on the GMDA’s efforts to address the challenges posed by this stretch, an official revealed the department is rolling out a Rs 11-crore project to upgrade it. “The tender has been allotted to a private firm that will repair this stretch — from Mehrauli-Gurugram Road to IFFCO Chowk, via Sikanderpur road — by layering bitumen all over. The contractor will also be liable for its maintenance for three years from the time work is completed,” the official said. He further pointed out that while earlier repair work on this stretch came under the department’s annual maintenance, the current project is listed as a special repair work. The 15m-green belt on either side is also in a deplorable state, with garbage, including C&D waste, littered on it and spilling over on the road. Commuters fear if the administration doesn’t take prompt action, this could spell doom in the monsoons. “I don’t know why we even call this a green belt. Fences lie broken, garbage is littered on it with no one to clean that. It’s as if the administration will wake up only during monsoon when garbage floods the road and chokes the drains,” said Nirmit, a commuter from Delhi. Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Haryana: Man arrested for raping 15-year.description: AMBALA: Police on Wednesday arrested a man for allegedly raping a 15-year-old girl in Haryana's Ropar district. According to the police, the accused has been identified as Dharampal (21). Dharampal was presented before the court on Thursday which sent him on a one-day police remand. The father of the girl had lodged a complaint at Naggal police station on June 6. “On June 6, my 15-year-old daughter had gone to Ambala City to purchase books and clothes but she did not return home,” the girl's father had stated in the FIR. Following the complaint, the Ambala police registered a case under Section 365 (Kidnapping or abducting with intent secretly and wrongfully to confine person) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) to start the investigation. “The girl knew the accused and on the day when she went missing, she was taken to a location in Ropar district from Ambala. Upon reaching there, she remained under the captivity of the accused for two days where she was raped. Earlier, the girl was misleading the investigating officers under the influence of the accused and had alleged that she had been raped by two-three persons. But after the arrest of all the named persons during our investigation we have established the evidence that she has been raped by Dharampal only. The girl has given her statement against the accused who has also confessed to his crime during the interrogation, a police officer said” Following the findings of the investigation, the Ambala police added Section 4 (punishment for penetrative sexual assault) of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act in the FIR. “We have almost completed our investigation into the case and as per the orders from the senior officials, the challan in the case will be presented in the court at the earliest," the officer added. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Child panel office too gets daycare cent.description: GURUGRAM: A day after a daycare centre was set up at the Mini Secretariat, another was inaugurated at the Child Welfare Committee (CWC) office in Sector 15’s Part 2 on Wednesday. The facility is expected to benefit not only CWC employees but also visitors who come to the office to file complaints along with their children. The centre was inaugurated by additional deputy commissioner Mohammed Imran Raza on Wednesday. The centre will have toys and books for children and a section for feeding babies like the Mini Secretariat daycare centre, which was inaugurated on June 18. Both centres have a woman attendant to look after children up to seven years of age. “This is a very child-friendly space created in our premises. Complainants visit our office with their children. This space will make children comfortable. They can play with toys, read books or draw pictures,” said Shankutala Dhull, chairperson, CWC Gurugram. The centre has been provided with books for children at present, but toys will be provided by June 23. This was the second inauguration of a daycare centre at a government building in Gurugram. A few workers availed the facility at Mini Secretariat on Wednesday after it was opened. Both the daycare centres can accommodate around 25 children each. The district administration plans to improve the facility based on the feedback they receive. A similar centre has been set up in the Sohna judicial complex. Confined for a year, woman from Jharkhan.description: GURUGRAM: Police and an NGO rescued a 20-year-old woman from Jharkhand from a house in South City-1, where she had allegedly been confined and forced to work as a domestic help for the past one year without wages. The woman came from Simdega in Jharkhand to Gurugram two and a half years ago after eloping with a man. The man, however, soon abandoned her, and she took to working as a domestic help to support herself. On Sunday, she managed to contact her family and told them that she had been confined in her employer’s house and working without wages. She told them that her employers locked her up when they went out and didn’t allow her to contact anybody. The family then approached the Childline helpline and local police. The Jharkhand Police contacted a city-based NGO Shakti Vahini, as well as their counterparts in Gurugram. On Tuesday, Shakti Vahini members and police reached the South City-1 house. It was found to be locked. When they broke in, they found the woman inside. The house owner claimed that they locked the house to keep the woman safe when they were not at home, police said. “The guardian of the woman approached us after filing a complaint with Childline. It seems to be a case of human trafficking,” Vijay Kujur, DSP (headquarters), Simdega, told TOI. Gurugram police commissioner Mohammad Akil said they will record the woman’s statement soon. AIIMS can't be built on forest land, Rao.description: GURUGRAM: Congress leader and former minister Captain Ajay Yadav has demanded Gurugram MP Rao Inderjit Singh’s resignation, alleging that he cheated the people of Rewari by promising AIIMS in Manethi village of the district. Yadav, who was the forest minister during the Congress regime, said he had been saying AIIMS can’t be set up on the land in Manethi village as it falls in the forest area, and now the forest advisory committee (FAC) of ministry of environment, forest and climate change (MoEF & CC) has denied environmental clearance to the project. However, when contacted, Inderjit Singh said the matter is under consideration with the Centre. “We are working on it. The issue of land for AIIMS in Rewari will be sorted out soon,” he said. During the Lok Sabha election campaign, Inderjit had promised to set up AIIMS in Rewari. A source in the chief minister’s office said Manohar Lal Khattar had in 2015 announced setting up of AIIMS in Manethi village of Rewari. However, when nothing happened till 2018, villagers went on an indefinite strike which lasted for 127 days. Before the Lok Sabha elections, the BJP government in the state had cleared the project worth Rs 1,299 crore in a cabinet meeting. It also earmarked 200-acre land with the help of the panchayat. Speaking to TOI, Yadav said the BJP MP should resign on moral grounds as he has played with the sentiments of people of south Haryana. “Even the former finance minister of the country had announced that funds have been passed for AIIMS. But it turned out to be another ‘jumla’ before the elections,” he said. He further said even Prime Minister Narendra Modi was aware that AIIMS could not be built in Manethi and “therefore he did not lay the foundation stone for the project”.He further said the BJP will face a setback in the forthcoming assembly elections The people have realised that the saffron party made false promises to them while seeking votes, he added. Rao Inderjit Singh is a former Congressman. He joined BJP later and won Lok Sabha elections in 2014 from Gurugram constituency. He contested against Congress’s Ajay Yadav in the 2019 Lok Sabha polls and defeated him by a huge margin of around 4 lakh votes. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

2-year-old female leopard electrocuted i.description: KHERLI LALA (GURUGRAM):A two-year-old female leopard was electrocuted in Kherli Lala village on Thursday morning. This is the 11th big cat to have died in the Gurugram and Faridabad area in the past decade. Villagers found the leopard hanging from 11kV high-tension wires near an Ailanthus excelsa (ullu neem) tree at 6.15am and called police, which reached the spot around 7.30am. Officials from the wildlife department arrived at 9am and took the carcass off the wire after cutting off the power supply. A post-mortem confirmed that the leopard, which weighed about 30 kilograms, had died of charring of multiple organs. According to Shyam Sunder Kaushik, district forest officer (wildlife), Gurugram, the leopard may have been trying to catch prey. “The carcass was entangled in the branches of the tree, which were also charred. The big cat might have climbed it to follow a monkey or langur. Its mouth may have become entangled in the wire, leading to electrocution.” Satvir Singh, a villager who was first to spot the carcass, said, “I was going to the temple when I saw a big cat hanging from the wires. When I called for help, many people gathered at the spot. We realised the leopard was dead. Its lower jaw was charred and mouth and ears were bleeding.” TOI visited the spot and found that the wires had been laid in the forest area about two years ago to supply power to Neelkanth temple, located about 150 metres away. The team also spotted nail marks of the leopard on the Ailanthus excelsa tree. As there is a water body right next to the tree, many animals, including monkeys, peacocks and bluebulls, visit the area every day. Locals alleged that the lack of water holes in the area force leopards to come to this village. “In 2016, when a leopard strayed into neighbouring Mandawar village, we requested the forest department to build some water holes so that wild animals don’t have to come to this area,” said Kapil Khatana, a resident of Kherli Lala. Some activists, however, said the leopard may have been trying to hide from humans and got electrocuted in the process. “It may have climbed up the tree to get a vantage view, rest or hide itself if it perceived a threat. It might have been unfamiliar with the area too,” said Prerna Bindra, former member, standing committee, National Board for Wildlife. She added that a decline in the prey base in the Aravalis could have forced big cats to come to human habitation in search of animals such as dogs and cattle. Urging vigilance, Bindra said: “Electrocution can be deliberate — for poaching, retaliatory killing or bush meat. Haphazardly strung power lines often prove fatal for birds and bats. If there are wires, they must be underground.” Activists said protection for villages like Kherli Lala and Mandawar that are situated in the wildlife corridor between Asola Bhatti Wildlife Sanctuary of Delhi and Sariska Tiger Reserve of Rajasthan. “Even though this is an accidental case, there is a clear case of negligence from the discom, Dakshin Haryana Bijli Vitran Nigam (DHBVN). It should have pruned the tree’s branches. There is a need to protect the wildlife corridor from all possible threats, including urbanisation. For many years, this has been an important passage as well as habitat for leopards in the Aravalis,” said Amit Chaudhery, a wildlife activist. When asked if the department was going to take this up with the discom, Vinod Kumar, additional principal chief conservator of forests, told TOI, “It is a case of electrocution. We have informed the area’s lineman and will write to them to prune the branches along high-tension wires. This is important as it poses a threat to wild animals.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Brawl at Bhondsi jail: Prisoner critical.description: GURUGRAM: An inmate of Bhondsi jail was attacked by four others on Tuesday morning inside the jail premises, police said on Wednesday. According to the police, an argument broke out between them and an inmate was hit with a sharp object and suffered grievous injuries. Police said he is out of danger and the four accused will be taken out on production warrant by police for questioning. According to police, Mohammad Sajid Khan, the deputy superintendent of Bhondsi jail, lodged a complaint on the matter on Tuesday morning. Khan said the four inmates have been identified as Neeraj, Jorawar, Pawan, and Hariom. They attacked Chandar Pal, who was in the same barrack, Khan added. According to police, Pal was thrashed badly by the four accused and he suffered injuries on his face, head, chest and hands. As the scuffle broke out, security warders in the jail interevened and rushed Pal to the jail hospital. “Legal action will be taken against the four inmates accused of the attack once the medico-legal report of the victim comes,” said the deputy superintendent of the jail. Acting on the complaint of the deputy superintendent of the prison, an FIR has been registered against the four accused under sections 323 (causing hurt), 324 (causing hurt by dangerous weapon) of the IPC at Bhondsi police station. “The cause behind the brawl inside the prison is not clear yet. After they are taken for a production warrant, we will find out the exact cause of the attack. The investigation is under way and action will be taken against the accused after verifying the facts,” said inspector Savit Kumar, SHO of Bhondsi police station. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rs 100 fine for not sorting waste: MCG.description: GURUGRAM: From July 1, households which don’t segregate their waste will be fined Rs 100 per day. MCG commissioner Vinay Singh issued the directive to senior officials of the sanitation department in a meeting on Tuesday. MCG had issued an advisory on Saturday stating that it is mandatory for residents to segregate their waste. Every household has been advised to install two separate bins — blue for dry waste and green for wet waste — outside their house for the MCG waste collection vans. Defaulters will be given 10 days’ warning period before they are fined, the commissioner said. Singh also asked officials to begin treating the city’s construction and demolition (C&D) waste at the earliest. The corporation is planning to launch two mobile treatment units that will treat C&D waste at 14 designated sites where such waste is being dumped every day, officials said. Officials were further directed to start the Basai C&D waste processing unit soon. Gurugram currently has no plant to process such waste. Directives were also issued to identify bulk waste generating sites in the city and treat waste after segregation. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Congress mulls bigger roles for Selja, H.description: CHANDIGARH: In yet another attempt to broker peace among the warring Congress leaders and to salvage the situation emerging out of crushing defeat in the parliamentary elections, the Congress high command is expected to bring in former Union minister Kumari Selja and former CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda on the forefront for the assembly polls. Sources said the party is seriously considering the move despite the fact that both of Selja and Hooda lost the recent elections from Ambala and Sonipat, respectively. Party sources said Selja could be a replacement for Ashok Tanwar, who also lost from Sirsa parliamentary seat. Hooda could be made CLP chief as well as the chairman of the coordination committee. Congress Haryana affairs in-charge Ghulam Nabi Azad has proposed this formula to the party high command, sources said. The final nod has to come from AICC president Rahul Gandhi. Sources said the picture will be clear in Haryana once Rahul takes a final decision about his own resignation as party chief. The Congress suffered a humiliating defeat as it lost all the 10 constituencies to the BJP, including Rohtak and Sonipat constituencies which were considered to be its safest bets in the state. Hooda's son Deepender failed to retain the family bastion of Rohtak. Afterwards, the rift among the leaders intensified as was evident during the meeting of coordination committee wherein state Congress chief Tanwar was targeted. Hooda group had sought removal of Tanwar as the state president and Kiran Choudhary as CLP leader. The entire episode had ended with an embarrassment when Tanwar allegedly abused Hooda aide and MLA Jai Tirath Dahiya, party insiders claimed. Notably, assembly elections in Haryana are just three months away. Besides making a comeback on the lines of Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan, Hooda faces the challenge of increasing the seat count in the assembly. Crimes by juveniles up 42% in 5 years, p.description: GURUGRAM: The number of crimes committed by juvenile has risen by 42% in the last five years, reveals the response to an RTI query. From 147 juveniles who faced trial for criminal activities in 2013, the number has shot up to 209 in 2018. In 2019 (till March), 46 juveniles have been booked and apprehended for their involvement in crimes. A police officer said juveniles mostly start with petty crimes like theft and snatching. With time, they graduate to heinous offences like rape and murder. Criminal gangs nurture juveniles and use them to execute crimes as they face lenient punishments under the Juvenile Justice Act, with a maximum punishment of three years in a correction home. According to the data received via an RTI query filed by activist Aseem Takyar, from 147 cases against juveniles in 2013, the number rose to 175 in 2014, and remained almost the same in 2015. Over the next two years, the numbers even dipped to 159 in 2016 and 148 in 2017. But in 2018, it again saw a steep rise. A police officer said most of the big criminals have committed crimes at a young age. To support his argument, he said in January this year, Gurugram police had arrested gangster Kaushal’s aide Chand (21), a shooter who had committed eight murders in Gurugram, Rewari and Delhi, with his first murder recorded in 2013 at the age of 16. At the age of 19, he had played a key role in the murder of rival gangster Mahesh ‘Attack’ in Gurugram 2016. Police said in the ‘Attack’ murder, Chand was accompanied by Sanjeet Vidroh, who was killed in an encounter by Delhi Police in Chhattarpur in 2018. Vidroh was also 16-years-old in 2016 when he took part in Attack’s murder. At 17, he was involved in the murder of liquor baron Manish Gujjar, brother of gangster Binder Gujjar and rival of gangster Sandeep Gadoli, who had by then been killed by Gurugram police in a hotel in Mumbai’s Andheri on July 6, 2016. “These are some incidents in which juveniles committed heinous crimes and went on to become big criminals,” said the police officer, adding that gangs catch them young and train them to become contract killers. In most cases, they start with petty crimes like snatching and theft, and graduate to heinous crimes. Elaborating further, he said teenagers are generally more aggressive and easily manipulated, and don’t come under police radar. In case they are caught, the punishment is lenient. Even for heinous offences like rape or murder, the maximum sentence a juvenile gets is three years in a correction home. ACP (crime) Shamsher Singh on Monday said they had arrested two teenagers in connection with the murder of a trader in Sadar Bazar. “During interrogation, they revealed they were inspired by older gangsters and wanted to emulate them. They picked up the gun to make their mark,” said Singh. A professor of sociology at Delhi School of Economics, Sunil Babu, said besides the juvenile, parents, friends and teachers are all responsible in some way or another for such developments. “Studies have shown that incidents of juvenile crime have increased due to lower social, economic or psychological backgrounds. In cases where juveniles from even well-to-do families venture into crime, their families are the prime reason,” said Babu, adding that it’s important to keep talking to teenagers and monitor their friends and associates. RTI activist booked for \u2018extort bid.description: GURUGRAM: An RTI activist has been booked for allegedly trying to extort Rs 5 lakh from a retired CRPF commandant. In his complaint, Sector 31 resident PS Dabar has alleged that RTI activist SK Sharma had threatened to highlight the alleged ownership of more than one Haryana Shahri Vikas Pradhikaran (earlier Huda) plot by him and his sons if the retired para-military officer didn’t pay the money. On his complaint, an FIR has been registered against Sharma under sections 386 (extortion) and 506 (criminal intimidation) of the IPC at Sector 40 police station, an officer said. However, this is not the first time that an FIR has been registered against Sharma. In 2014 too, an FIR was registered against him for cheating, criminal breach of trust and criminal conspiracy at DLF Phase I police station after a retired army officer had complained that Sharma tried to extort money from him. In the latest case, Dabar has claimed that Sharma had called him on May 18 on his mobile phone and said he wanted to discuss about a HSVP plot owned by the senior citizen in Jhajjar. One of Dabar’s sons is a colonel in the army, while another is a commandant in BSF. “Sharma said he was busy and asked me to come to his house. He said that it is wrong to have two government plots — one in Jhajjar and another in Gurugram. I told him that I have purchased the Jhajjar plot from someone, while the Gurugram plot has been allotted in the reserved category,” Dabar told cops. “Even after my explanation, Sharma threatened to file an RTI and defame me. After few days, he called me again and demanded Rs 5 lakh, claiming he is well known to senior officials, and then started blackmailing and harassing me. I was scared with his threat calls and then finally decided to file the complaint,” he said. When contacted, the RTI activist said he had highlighted the plot allotment scam in 2013 and since then 1,500 FIRs have been registered at various police stations in the state. “All the allegations are baseless.” “We have registered a case and are verifying the facts. Action will be taken as per law,” said inspector Pawan Kumar, SHO of Sector 40 police station. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. \nJim Sarbh's fashionable outing in Gurg.description: 'Padmaavat' actor Jim Sarbh was in town recently, attending a fashion event. Clad in a sleeveless hand-embroidered high-quality multi-functional jacket, the actor was seen sharing nitty-gritties of acting and his idea about fashion and style. The musical afternoon was organised at a pub in Gurgaon. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Amit Shah, Manohar Lal Khattar to join R.description: ROHTAK: Union home minister Amit Shah will participate in a state-level celebration of International Yoga Day in Rohtak in Haryana on Friday. Chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar, along with state’s health minister Anil Vij and other senior ministers and officials, will also take part in the celebration, which is likely to see participation by around 25,000 volunteers. Although the event, to be held at Pashu Mela Ground in the city, is being dubbed as “apolitical”, the state unit of Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) with its target of “Abki Baar 75 Paar” in the 90-member House is seeing it as a big opportunity to start its campaign for the assembly polls in October. Shah, under whose leadership the Haryana BJP scripted historic victory of 10/10 seats in the recent Lok Sabha polls, was scheduled to reach Rohtak on Thursday night and leave for Delhi after attending morning Yoga Day event the next morning. Previously, Rohtak had been a stronghold of former chief minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda, and his son -- three-time MP Deepender Singh. But both tall Jat leaders were defeated by BJP nominees in Sonipat and Rohtak in the recent parliamentary elections. Political analysts see this development as a morale booster for the state BJP for achieving its target of “Abki Baar 75 Paar” and many of the local leaders have been making a beeline to join the BJP since the rout of opposition. Khattar reached Rohtak on Thursday evening to oversee the preparations for the Yoga Day event, while DGP Manoj Yadav was in the city to see the security measures taken for the gathering of VVIPs. Rohtak deputy commissioner R S Verma said for a smooth conduct of event, it has been divided into 63 sectors under the supervision of 13 sector magistrates and Patanjali Yoga experts. The police said they have set up 18 check-points around the Rohtak city and those coming to attend the event would be able to reach the venue directly without entering the city. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Batra alleges Rs 130 crore scam in comme.description: ROHTAK: Former Congress MLA from Rohtak, Bharat Bhushan Batra, on Wednesday alleged that Manohar Lal Khattar-led BJP government in Haryana is involved in Rs 130-crore multi-level parking-cum-commercial complex construction scam. He also alleged involvement of Rohtak Municipal Corporation officials and Haryana cooperative minister Manish Grover. Addressing a press conference here, Batra said that the project in Rohtak was given to three companies -- Richa Industries Ltd, Richa Krishna Constructions Pvt Ltd and IND Solutions Pvt Ltd. “But these companies do not fulfil the eligibility criteria,” he claimed. “According to rules, a company which can be given tender should meet three conditions: it should be at least five years’ old, its turnover by March 31, 2018 should have been Rs 20 crore and its net worth should be Rs 5 crore. Two of the companies do not fulfil the norms and the third company has been facing insolvency process,” he told the media. “If any company is undergoing the process of insolvency, it can’t be given a government project. But here, it was awarded tender for construction by throwing rules out of window,” Batra alleged. “This project has been leased for 99 years with the upfront premium of Rs 2.7 crore and annual lease price of Rs 2,24,112. The project, including 997-square meter (1,300 sq yards) land, commercial basement of four floors and cafeteria area on the top floor, has an estimated cost of Rs 17 crore. By spending Rs 19.70 crore, there is a plan for the companies to earn approximately Rs 130 crore by selling the commercial area,” Batra alleged. He alleged that the land was sold in a planned manner to Richa Krishna Constructions, which was registered just a day before the start of the process of tender bid. Batra demanded that the tender be cancelled without any delay so that the government money could be saved. He said that a CBI probe would expose BJP’s Rohtak MLA Manish Grover, and municipal corporation and senior officials in Chandigarh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Gurugram: As squatters take over green b.description: GURUGRAM: MCG, responding to persistent complaints from residents of Emerald Estate in Sector 65 that culminated in a tweet by a resident on Tuesday, took immediate action to remove illegal encroachments by vendors and kiosks in the green belt along Golf Course Road (extension), removing them all. Emerald Estate residents have been complaining to MCG for months that encroachers were setting up illegal shops on the green belt in their neighbourhood — where they have been planting trees to increase green cover — eating away the green belt and compromising the safety and security of hundreds of families living in condominiums on the stretch. The complainants said they have pleaded with MCG officials to take immediate action against the encroachers, before the green zone turned into an illegal vending zone. MCG officials acknowledged that the encroachments have not only destroyed the green space, but also deprived pedestrians of space. Roadside parking is another problem, which they said causes huge traffic jams on the stretch during peak hours. A senior MCG official told TOI that many illegal shops, eateries and liquor vends have come up on the road between sectors 62 and 65, which have spoiled the development plan of the authorities, adding that after Tuesday’s tweet by a resident, they decided to take immediate action, and sent over a team at around 2pm, who removed all encroachments. “Encroachments on SPR have given rise to security concerns in the area and made the area accident-prone,” said Abhay Singh, a resident of Emerald Estate, whose tweet precipitated Tuesday’s anti-encroachment drive. He added, “We’re happy to see prompt action by the MCG team in response to my tweet on encroachments on the green belt in Sector 65. I hope such violations don’t get repeated. We have plans to restart our plantation drive in the belt adjacent to our society.” Shwetabh Goel said in the past six months, encroachment by roadside ven-dors around their society has increased. “We’ve on several occasions alerted both MCG and HSVP about this, but so far, they hadn’t extended any help. Not only this, street lights near our society are not functional, which, along with these encroachments, are a security risk. There have been some incidents in the past,” he said. Another resident, Pratik Prakash, said, “MCG was prompt enough to act on people’s concern in this case. With the illicit shops now removed, we can resume our plantation drive.” But he added, “MCG needs to keep a tab on this area as these illegal vendors may return soon.” Additional municipal commissioner Y S Gupta said, “On the strict instructions of newly appointed commissioner Vinay Singh, regarding removal of illegal encroachments, the MCG team acted promptly and cleared the encroachment in Sector 65. There were complaints by residents in this regard.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two arrested in Meerut for Gurugram trad.description: GURUGRAM: Two more accused, involved in the murder of the cloth merchant in Sadar Bazar, were arrested from Meerut on Monday night. With this, police claim to have arrested all five accused involved in the case. The accused — Saurabh Kumar (19) and Ajay Kumar (19) told police that they were inspired by the lifestyle most gangsters followed and wanted to be a part of the crime world. They confessed that they were with Suraj Katari —the prime accused in the case — when Sudhir Taneja was shot dead in Sadar Bazar, police said. “Saurabh and Ajay along with Kataria had intercepted Taneja around 9.30pm on May 28, when the trader was returning home after closing his shop. They first tried to snatch the bag containing cash from Taneja at gunpoint, but when he resisted and raised an alarm, they shot him and fled with his scooter,” an officer said. According to the police, Suraj Katari — a history-sheeter against whom more than six cases registered — was arrested from Basai, Manoj, a resident of Kumhar mohalla, was arrested from Mata Mandir while Suraj, a resident of Hathras in UP, was nabbed from Jyoti Park. “The trio’s interrogation gave us vital clues about Saurabh and Ajay. A police team lead by sub-inspector Rajkumar from crime unit of Sector 39 arrested the duo from Meerut on Monday night. Saurabh was so impressed by the crime world that he had also kept a nickname for himself — Mahakal,” an officer said. “The duo have no criminal record and probably this was their first big crime,” said ACP (crime) Shamsher Singh. \nFemale riders from NCR take on Delhi r.description: On Sunday morning, about 20 women from across Delhi-NCR put on their riding boots, jackets, and helmets; got on their mean machines, and rode the cruisers for 40km across Lutyen's Delhi and the Aravalli trails of Gurgaon. The occasion was the International Women's Day Ride organized by the Women's International Motorcycling Association (WIMA), which had women, not just from WIMA, but also first-timers and amateurs. They started at the break of dawn from Janpath and rode across Lutyen’s Delhi, Hauz Khas, and Chhatarpur before entering Gurgaon through the Aravalli trails and ending their ride at a dhaba on the Gurgaon-Faridabad Road.  Zooming through Delhi: 20 women from NCR rode bikes for 40km across Lutyen's Delhi and the Aravalli trails of Gurgaon Vidhi Malla, National President of WIMA, led the ride and said that this was an occasion to spread the message that biking is not just a male domain but open to everyone with passion. "We thought of using the Women's Day as an occasion to get the entire female biking community of Delhi together. We had 20 girls riding together and it was great because it included everyone from veterans to girls who were doing a long ride for the first time," she said. The riders from Janpath to Gurgaon, taking a back trail instead of the usual roads that lead into Gurgaon. "We took a more scenic route that is not very commonly used by bikers, which meant there was a little off-roading involved too. It was fantastic," said Vidhi.  Vidhi Malla  The riders found the experience quite fun and also said that such rides are essential to put a spotlight on female bikers from NCR. Niharika Singh Dalal, a rescue diver from Delhi, said, "I think events like these promote riding for women because you see women coming together as a team here. You see community building, where women encourage each other and improve each other's skills and that's always great."  The ride was organised to gather female bikers using Women's Day as the occasion 01:36Female riders from NCR take on Delhi roads ahead of Women's DayDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

H1B Visa news.description: WASHINGTON: The Trump administration has no plans to cap H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally, the state department said on Thursday. Reuters reported on Wednesday that the United States had told India it was considering restricting the H-1B visa programmes for countries with the data storage requirement. The H-1B programme issues US visas to skilled foreign workers. US mulling 15% cap on H-1B visa for Indians"The Trump Administration has no plans to place caps on H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally," a state department spokeswoman said in a statement in response to the Reuters article. While an administration's "Buy American Hire American" executive order calls for a broad review of US worker visa programs, including the H-1B programme, it was not targeted at a specific country, the spokeswoman said. It is "completely separate from our ongoing discussions with India about the importance of ensuring the free flow of data across borders," the spokeswoman added. Earlier on Thursday, India said it was in talks with the United States on H-1B visas, but foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar told a news conference: "We have not heard anything officially from the US government" on capping such permits for Indians. US secretary of state Mike Pompeo is scheduled to visit New Delhi next week for talks that will include areas of disagreement between the two countries over trade. H-1B cap for India? It’s not easy and may need approval by US Congress, say expertsTwo senior Indian officials told Reuters on Wednesday they had been briefed last week on a US plan to cap the number of H-1B visas given annually to Indians at between 10% and 15% of the total number issued. There is no country-specific limit on the 85,000 H-1B work visas the United States issues every year, and an estimated 70% of them go to Indians.
